holidays.name: World Press Freedom Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate and raise awareness about the importance of press freedom and the challenges journalists face worldwide.
holidays.origin: Proclaimed by the United Nations in 1993 to remind governments of the need to respect and uphold the right to freedom of expression.
holidays.funFact: Despite digital media's rise, around 70% of the world's population still experiences restrictions on press freedom!

holidays.name: Two Different Colored Shoes Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to wear two different colored shoes to celebrate uniqueness and embrace quirky fashion choices.
holidays.origin: Started on social media as a fun way to promote individuality and break fashion norms.
holidays.funFact: People who wear mismatched shoes often say it sparks conversations and makes their day more cheerful!

holidays.name: National Paranormal Day
holidays.description: Dedicated to celebrating all things supernatural, from ghost stories and UFOs to spirits and hauntings.
holidays.origin: Began online in the early 2000s as paranormal enthusiasts decided they needed a day to share their eerie experiences.
holidays.funFact: May 3 is believed by some ghost hunters to be a prime night for paranormal activity!
